intro: Senecio subauritus, commonly known as the auriculate senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with a distinctive auriculate base, giving it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in a compact cluster, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Senecio subauritus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
